text: Hey! Is it still not possible to redirect form submissions on a page level only (meaning, not under options in the forms editor)?
It is still possible to use a user-defined redirect outside of HubSpot Forms. We use different approaches to enable conditional custom redirects.
How are you fetching the redirect_url on page level? Mine is null

check your configuration options, see here
<https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/forms/advanced_form_options>

We are already using the `redirectUrl` attribute when creating the form. The issue we're encountering is that it becomes `null` if you add the redirect on a page level. However, I notice that `redirect_id` is set when adding a redirect on a page level. Are you utilizing that? Otherwise, I'm not entirely following your suggestion.
```redirectUrl: URL to which the form will redirect upon a successful form completion. Cannot be used with inlineMessage.```
```inlineMessage: Inline message to display in place of the form upon a successful form completion. Cannot be used with redirectUrl.```
I think you’ve probably already figured this out but… everything’s back to normal now :raised_hands:
